item.createaddition.multimeter.title: [Multimeter]:
item.createaddition.multimeter.no_capabi: No Forge Energy capability on this side.
item.createaddition.multimeter.tooltip.s: Measures _capacity_ and _input/output_ on any side with a _Forge energy capability_.
item.createaddition.copper_spool.tooltip: R-Clicking two _Connectors_ will create a wire link between them and return an _Empty Spool_.
item.createaddition.gold_spool.tooltip.s: R-Clicking two _Connectors_ will create a wire link between them and return an _Empty Spool_.
item.createaddition.spool.tooltip.summar: R-Clicking two _Connectors_ linked by a wire will remove the wire link and return a filled _spool_.
deprecated.block.createaddition.electric: Generates _su_ from _fe_ and has configurable _speed_. The energy consumption is based on the set _rpm_.
deprecated.block.createaddition.alternat: Generates _fe_ from _su_. The amount of energy produced is based on _rpm_.
deprecated.block.createaddition.rolling_: A kinetic component suitable for _rolling_ inserted _materials_. Can be powered by connecting to the shaft at the sides. Results have to be extracted from the component.
Starts applying _rolling recipes_ to any items inserted from the side or the top of the block.
block.createaddition.heater.engine_heati: Heating Furnace Engines has been disabled in the Configs.
deprecated.block.createaddition.heater.t: When attached to a _Furnace_ and powered with _fe_ from the top will heat the _Furnace_. Will not power a _Furnace Engine_ unless _enabled_ in the _configs_.
block.createaddition.accumulator.tooltip: Provides _fe_ to all _wires_ connected to the _connector_ marked in _white_.
Accepts _fe_ on any side except on the top and from any _wires_ connected to the unmarked _connector_.
block.createaddition.connector.tooltip.s: Connects Forge Energy compatible blocks with _wires_ to transfer _fe_.
block.createaddition.connector.tooltip.a: While holding a _Copper Spool_ or _Gold Spool_ to create a _wire link_ between two _Connectors_.
block.createaddition.redstone_relay.tool: Allows _fe_ to pass from the _input connector_ to the _output connector_ when receiving a _redstone signal_.
Provides _fe_ to all _wires_ connected to the _connector_ marked in _white_.
Accepts _fe_ from the _wires_ connected to the unmarked _connector_.
block.createaddition.furnace_burner.tool: This _Furnace_ won't smelt items, but can instead be used to power a _Furnace Engine_ without the need for a smelting recipe. _Fuel_ can be inserted using for example a _Hopper_.
block.createaddition.crude_burner.toolti: The _Crude Burner_ consume slow-burning _flammable liquids_ like _Seed Oil_ to power the _Furnace Engine_. The _liquid fuel_ can be inserted using _Fluid Pipes_.
createaddition.command.cca_api.link: Click here to open API documentation
create.ponder.electric_motor.header: Generating Rotational Force using Electric Motors
create.ponder.electric_motor.text_1: Electric Motors are a compact and configurable source of Rotational Force
create.ponder.electric_motor.text_2: Scrolling on the back panel changes the RPM of the motors' rotational output
create.ponder.electric_motor.text_3: The Electric Motor requires a source of energy (fe)
create.ponder.electric_motor.text_4: The motors' energy consumption is determined by the set RPM
create.ponder.alternator.header: Generating Electric energy using an Alternator
create.ponder.alternator.text_1: The Alternator requires atleast 32 RPM to operate
create.ponder.alternator.text_2: It generates electric energy (fe) from rotational force
create.ponder.alternator.text_3: It's energy production is determined by the input RPM
create.ponder.rolling_mill.header: Rolling metals into Rods and Wires
create.ponder.rolling_mill.text_1: The Rolling Mill uses rotational force to roll metals into Rods and Wires
create.ponder.rolling_mill.text_2: To manually input items, drop Ingots or Plates on the top of the Mill
create.ponder.rolling_mill.text_3: Right-click the Mill to manually retrieve the output items
create.ponder.automated_rolling_mill.tex: The Rolling Mill can be automated using a Belt and two Funnels
create.ponder.heater.header: Using electric energy to heat a furnace
create.ponder.heater.text_1: The heater can be placed on any side facing the furnace
create.ponder.heater.text_2: When connected to a sufficient source of electric energy (fe), the Heater will light the Furnace
create.ponder.heater.text_3: The Furnace will stay lit as long as enough energy is provided
create.ponder.cc_electric_motor.header: Using ComputerCraft to control an Electric Motor
create.ponder.cc_electric_motor.text_1: The Electric Motor can be controlled using ComputerCraft
create.ponder.cc_electric_motor.text_3: Get to the API documentation by issuing the command '/cca_api' in the chat
